thinking.disposable_income: Mount Greenwood is a middle to upper-middle class area with median household income around $87,000. Many residents are police officers, firefighters, and other city workers with stable incomes. The area has one of the highest rates of homeownership in Chicago
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have moderate to high discretionary spending power. Most households own cars and have significant retail spending. The community can generally absorb moderate increases in transportation costs without severe impact on quality of life
thinking.accessibility: The area is car-dependent with limited public transit access. Most residents rely on personal vehicles for commuting and daily trips. The Metra Rock Island line serves the area but with limited frequency. Bus service is available but not extensive. The community is relatively far from downtown Chicago
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Given high car dependency, avoid highest driving fees to prevent excessive burden on residents. 2. Moderate tax increase acceptable to improve overall transportation system. 3. Higher transit fares acceptable since transit usage is lower. 4. Prioritize policies that reduce car travel times since most residents drive. 5. Balance between system improvements and cost burden on car-dependent residents. Selected policies provide meaningful travel time improvements while keeping costs manageable for middle-class households
